title: Elbow, Giants of All Sizes, review: gorgeous melodies from Guy Garvey's dark night of the soul
text:
You know we must be living through troubled times if even Guy Garvey is feeling beaten down.

Elbow’s most famous anthem, One Day Like This, featured their avuncular frontman avowing that a single day of joy was enough to see him through a whole year. By contrast, Elbow’s eighth album, Giants of All Sizes, starts with the battered optimist declaring “I don’t know Jesus any more” and plunges emotionally downhill from there. The 45-year-old singer and radio broadcaster has spoken about how the current fractured political state has taken a toll on his spirit, compounded by the death of his father and two close friends.

On seven-minute opening track Dexter & Sinister, he likens himself to “a bird...
description: You know we must be living through troubled times if even Guy Garvey is feeling beaten down.
